Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; traces of two added red bands; exterior: around rim, maeander band between dot and billet bands; below, painted decoration consisting of hindquarters of a lion with dotted underbelly, to left (tail overlapping rim pattern above); pendant roundel, dot rosettes and lozenges as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 236, no. 155, pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0152) (phase 2)
